titleStmt.title: List of villages in the Themistou meris
titleStmt.author: Unknown

msContents.summary: A list of villages with amounts of grain credited to each by certain individuals who were undoubtedly sitologoi. Of the 12 villages named, 3 of them whose location has not been previously known with any exactness, have marginal notes describing them as adjacent to specific villages whose locations are vely well known to us due to the excavations of Grenfell and Hunt. These are: Ptolemais, Ptolemais Drymou and Alexandrou Nesos, which are said to be adjacent to Euemeria, Dionysias and Theadelphia respectively.

msItem.note: Left margin is c. 2.3 cm. Some notes written in the left hand side margin. Cancellation of line 19 with two encircling strokes.

p.note: The papyrus is broken of the lower and right hand side.

origin.origPlace: village of Euhemeria, Themistou meris, Arsinoite nome, Egypt

provenance.p: Kasr el Banat,Fayum (village of Euhemeria, Themistou meris, Arsinoite nome, Egypt)

keywords.term: Pu[rreia; Sentrepaei; Ptolemais Drymou; Argias; Alexandrou Nesos; Archelais; Ptolemais; Psentymis; Kanopias; Euemeria; Theadelphia; Dionysias

div.ab: of Pu[rreia;of Sentrepaei [;and from the account [;of Ptolemais Drymou [;of Argias [;of Alexandrou Nesos [;of Archelais [;of Eudaimon, son of E[;of Ptolemais [;of Ptolemais Drymou [;of Alexandrou Nesos [;of Psentymis [;of his wheat [;of Kanopias [;of Psent[ymis;of Euhm[ereia;of Sentr[epaei;of Theadelph[eia;and from the account of [ (this line is cancelled);of Zoil[os;in the left margin opposite ll. 9-11 adjacent to Euhmeria; adjacent to Dionysias; adjacent to Theadelpheia
